column41: DOR operate a 13 period finance reporting calendar of four weeks each, while the DfT operate a 12 period financial calendar per annum.  Once a year therefore, DOR has a catch-up period.  The February return has the catch-up period and is therefore reporting eight weeks and not the usual four weeks.
